title: Historical stock splits and corporate actions related to DoorDash Inc stock

content.text: DoorDash Inc announces a partnership with convenience store chain 7-Eleven, allowing customers to order groceries and other items through the DoorDash app.
DoorDash Inc goes public and starts trading on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) under the ticker symbol DASH.
DoorDash Inc experiences a significant surge in stock price on its first day of trading, closing at $189.51 per share, well above its initial public offering (IPO) price of $102 per share.
DoorDash Inc announces a secondary offering of 5 million shares at a price of $140 per share.
DoorDash Inc completes its stock split, increasing the number of shares outstanding. Shareholders receive an additional two shares for each share held.
DoorDash Inc's stock price adjusts following the stock split, reducing the price per share.
DoorDash Inc announces the acquisition of Chowbotics, a provider of food preparation robots, in an effort to enhance its delivery capabilities.
DoorDash Inc announces a partnership with Albertsons Companies, allowing customers to order groceries from Safeway, Vons, and other Albertsons-owned stores through the DoorDash app.

news.headline: Marqeta 'still on track' despite post-earnings stock dip: CEO
news.summary: Marqeta (MQ) shares fell Thursday despite beating revenue estimates in their fourth quarter earnings. CEO Simon Khalaf joins Yahoo Finance Live to discuss why he believes the company is "still on track." Khalaf explains Marqeta's core business –– card issuing and processing and dispute management services –– comprise the bulk of their client offerings. He adds that Marqeta works beyond financial services alone, with "embedded finance customers" also a component of the company's sales. As the industry expands and competition increases, Khalaf says Marqeta aims to move into a space in the market where there are "only the new players, not the established players." He sees a key opportunity to focus the company's efforts on the "issuing side" of the embedded finance space –– an area with little competition currently. For more expert insight and the latest market action, click here to watch this full episode of Yahoo Finance Live. Editor's note: This article was written by Angel Smith

news.headline: DoorDash Announces Partnership with Pet Supplies Plus for On-Demand Delivery
news.summary: SAN FRANCISCO, February 27, 2024--DoorDash (NASDAQ: DASH), the local commerce platform, today announced a new partnership with Pet Supplies Plus, the largest and most trusted pet retail franchise, to offer on-demand delivery of pet essentials from 720 locations. Whether it’s restocking food for their furry, feathery, or scaly friends, or indulging their pet with a new treat, pet parents can now enjoy the convenience of same-day delivery on DoorDash.

news.headline: DoorDash stock rises on upgrade from Morgan Stanley
news.summary: Shares DoorDash (DASH) are moving higher on Thursday after the stock received an upgrade to Overweight from Equal-Weight at Morgan Stanley. In a note to clients, the analysts behind the upgrade say that the company "continues to deliver peer-leading and better-than-expected consumer spend and gross order value results across its expanding platform." Yahoo Finance Anchors Josh Lipton and Julie Hyman break down the latest development for DoorDash and what it could mean for the company moving forward. For more expert insight and the latest market action, click here to watch this full episode of Yahoo Finance Live. Editor's note: This article was written by Nicholas Jacobino

news.headline: DoorDash’s 2023 Community Impact Report Demonstrates Real World Impact Across U.S.
news.summary: SAN FRANCISCO, February 20, 2024--DoorDash (NASDAQ: DASH) today released its 2023 Community Impact Report, which demonstrates that DoorDash helps merchants by increasing their profits and reach, consumers by saving time and more easily accessing essential items, and Dashers by providing the opportunity to earn what they need, when they need it, on their own terms.
